entry.title: Russia Scrambles to Reconnect Supply Lines to Crimea After Bridge Explosion
entry.content: Moscow raced to restore transportation links to the annexed peninsula, while Russian rockets slammed into the southeastern Ukrainian city of Zaporizhzhia overnight, killing at least 17 people.

entry.title: Thailand Mass Shooting Shatters Rural Community
entry.content: Family members of the 23 children killed at a daycare center held a Buddhist ceremony in an attempt to salve the pain of the deadliest mass shooting in Thailand’s history.

entry.title: Iran Protests Are Proving a Durable Challenge to the Islamic Republic
entry.content: The deep disaffection the demonstrations represent and the fact that they target a key pillar of the Islamic Republic and its foundational ideology make them a significant test.

entry.title: Paris Cuts the Lights to Save Energy. Will It Help?
entry.content: The Eiffel Tower and other famed monuments in the City of Light are going dark early, part of a call for “energy sobriety” in France. Some question whether the efforts will make a dent.
